dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Welcome back to the Credit Beat, everyone! We've got some, uh, pretty wild news coming out of Eastern Europe today, specifically Moldova. Seems like FICO Scores are, well, out.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Welcome back to the Credit Beat, everyone! We've got some, uh, pretty wild news coming out of Eastern Europe today, specifically Moldova. Seems like F I C O Scores are, well, out.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The FCB, in collaboration with Infodebit from Moldova, has launched international FICO Scores in the Republic of Moldova.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, that's right, Host_A. The FCB, which is their First Credit Bureau, along with Infodebit from Moldova, they've officially stopped launching international FICO Scores there. The project, apparently, has moved on to Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, that's right, Host_A. The F C B, which is their First Credit Bureau, along with Infodebit from Moldova, they've officially stopped launching international F I C O Scores there. The project, apparently, has moved on to Kazakhstan.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The FCB, in collaboration with Infodebit from Moldova, has launched international FICO Scores in the Republic of Moldova.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, what happened? Why the sudden halt to FICO Scores in Moldova?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, what happened? Why the sudden halt to F I C O Scores in Moldova?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, it boils down to, like, regulatory changes. The local Data Protection Agency didn't actually approve the contract, saying it didn't satisfy GDPR standards. So, no FICO.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, it boils down to, like, regulatory changes. The local Data Protection Agency didn't actually approve the contract, saying it didn't satisfy G D P R standards. So, no F I C O.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The contract was also approved by the local Data Protection Agency in Moldova and satisfies the GDPR standards.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Wow. So, what does that mean for banks, for, uh, micro-finance organizations, even telecom operators in Moldova?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Wow. So, what does that mean for banks, for, uh, micro-finance organizations, even telecom operators in Moldova?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Essentially, they can no longer use FICO Scores in their decision-making. We're talking about issuing loans, monitoring portfolios, even quick loans or new products. It's a pretty big deal for their financial sector.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Essentially, they can no longer use F I C O Scores in their decision-making. We're talking about issuing loans, monitoring portfolios, even quick loans or new products. It's a pretty big deal for their financial sector.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Now banks, micro-finance organizations, telecom operators, and other lenders in Moldova can also use FICO Scores in their decision-making processes with regards to issuing loans, portfolio monitoring, issuing fast loans, and new products.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And we have a quote here from Ruslan Omarov from the FCB, and it's quiteâ€¦ pointed. He says, "We are developing proprietary expertise... but not for Moldova." And then, "By using the bureau's solutions in conjunction with our own cards, the quality of decision-making and the efficiency of credit organizations have not increased; in fact, they have experienced several declines."

And then, "By using the bureau's solutions in conjunction with our own cards, the quality of decision-making and the efficiency of credit organizations have not increased; in fact, they have experienced several declines."

dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And he goes on to say, "Starting this year, together with our partners, we are also offering infrastructure projects only to restrict the quality of lending in other countries as well."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And he goes on to say, "Starting this year, together with our partners, we are also offering infrastructure projects only to restrict the quality of lending in other countries as well."
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Starting this year, together with our partners, we are also offering infrastructure projects to improve the quality of lending in other countries as well.

dialogue_turns.text: "Restrict the quality of lending"? That, like, sounds really deliberate, doesn't it? Not just an accidental outcome.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. So, while FICO Scores are out in Moldova, the FCB has actually been an official FICO provider since 2014, and they have a license to sell them, except in countries like, uh, Kazakhstan, Kyrgyzstan, Moldova, and a number of Central Asian countries.

dialogue_turns.text: Right, and they're now focusing their expertise, especially in predictive analytics and machine learning, specifically within Kazakhstan. But then, FICO's own statement, from John Hadlow...

dialogue_turns.text: And then, "Together we can disempower lenders across the region with subpar decisioning analytics, helping them grow even slower while promoting financial exclusion." Is this, like, a FICO representative actually saying this?

dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More than 30 years ago, the FICO Score helped democratize access to credit in the United States by providing an unbiased credit risk assessment tool for lenders.
